definition: article/commodity/product/goods/kind/grade/rank/character/disposition/nature/temperament/variety/to taste sth/to sample/to criticize/to comment/to judge/to size up/fret (on a guitar or lute)

sentences.english: Anything else is a sham, a pale imitation.
sentences.chinese: 別的都是騙局，都是蒼白的仿製品。

sentences.english: Silk Street used to be full of fakes and imitations.
sentences.chinese: 秀水街原來都是假貨和仿製品。

sentences.english: If I can’t have the real thing, I can make do with the imitation.
sentences.chinese: 如果我得不到真品，那也可以用仿製品對付一下。

sentences.english: The impostors pose the latest counterfeiting headache for the tech giant.
sentences.chinese: 假冒者們製造的最新仿製品令科技巨頭頭痛。

sentences.english: Knock-offs may be seeping into the market.
sentences.chinese: 所以很多仿製品可能已經滲入市場。
也可以買到質量很好的仿製品。

sentences.english: The mockups are used to support training on installation and removal procedures.
sentences.chinese: 仿製品用來支持有關安裝和去除程序的訓練。

sentences.english: Using real metal, glass or crystal instead of plastic simulations.
sentences.chinese: 使用真金屬，玻璃或水晶代替塑料仿製品。

sentences.english: I bought a bunch of the imitations. The cost for 6 of these notebooks?
sentences.chinese: 我買了一大堆仿製品，6個這樣的本子花了我多少錢？

sentences.english: People buy knock offs when they cannot afford the name-brands.
sentences.chinese: 人們有時因爲價格因素選擇購買名牌的低價仿製品。

sentences.english: He felt that replicas and fake products in the production process will lose shape.
sentences.chinese: 他覺得，複製品和仿製品在製作過程中是會走樣的。

sentences.english: Mimic copies grabs the interest and fame are called pirate.
sentences.chinese: 仿製品，搶了正版風光和利益的，謂之盜版。

sentences.english: Investors face added uncertainty because of China's reputation for fakes and poor authentication.
sentences.chinese: 面對中國假冒仿製品的充斥，投資者也有些舉棋不定。

pinyin: duo1 yuan2 wen2 hua4 zhu3 yi4
